item.title: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

sanga282:

waffendennis he convieniantly ignored your previous post, but as for this current point its about america producing hardly any horsepower per 1000cc, regardless if they are from japan it still proves america need to get some actual engineers not some 5 year olds who have upgraded from mechano

I’m with you on that one! They indeed hardly produce any true power per liter.
Thats what I was trying to prove too.

Displacement is not everything, good engineering and research>displacement.
It amazed me that they finnaly started using Mc Pherson struts instead of leave springs, or just a rack as suspension wich give the poor handeling.

item.source: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars

item.title: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

[quote=“zoltanman, post:162, topic:266373”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=351831.msg2973953#msg2973953 date=1254119103]

All cars in this thread suck. Volvo > *

do love the box style of the old volvo estates and the design on the C30 is pretty nice as well
zoltanman how did you prove me wrong? i just showed you two cars with different size engines and massively different horsepowers. Regardless of what they are for you dont put an engine in a car and then only use half its potential thats ridiculous. Also pretty sure you got your prices wrong, this is the only second hand zo6 vette i can find on autotrader and its £42,500
and this is the closest i could find to the evo and its £16,995
both used cars massive price differences l2getfacts before posting

oh so pick a 2 year old evo with more miles on it than the corvette? No shit its a lower price

how about compare them new.

that was the mitsubishi i used in my exmample, I wasnt going to change it for price comparison, he said a zo6 would be cheaper than the evo XIII
edit: @ zoltanmann thats an evo X i thought you said you’ve been around garages, also look at the horsepower per 1000cc engine size on both of those cars the evo has more per 1000cc
[/quote]

GOD YOU’RE A FUCKING IDIOT.

Show me a engine WITHOUT forced induction. That engine naturally aspirated doesn’t produce more power per cylinder than the vette. Slap forced induction on the vette then, then it’ll be fair to compare right? Oh wait, you don’t need to because the chevy engine will produce more for less.[/quote]

Do I need to pull out the list with Honda engines again?

Let’s take examples:

B16A: 4 inline 1.6 liter 170HP < Civic VTI (FWD)
B16B: 4 inline 1.6 liter 185HP < Civic Type-R (FWD)
B18C '98 Spec (Type-R): 4 inline 1.8 liter 220HP < Integra Type-R (FWD)
H22A: 4 inline 2.2 liter 220HP < Prelude VTI (FWD)
K20A: 4 inline 2.0 liter 240HP < Civic Type-R/Integra RSX (FWD)
F20C: 4 inline 2.0 liter 250HP < S2000 (RWD)
C32B: V6 3.2 liter 300HP < NSX (RWD)
C35B: V6 3.5 liter 500HP < NSX GT-R (RWD)

I think I see one engine that comes close to the C5 Z06 engine, no forced injection ‘just’ a V6 3.2 liter engine and produces 300HP.
And the C35B V6 3.5 liter has no forced injection either, and it produces 500 HP, thats way more than the C5 Z06 engine has (385HP).
It handles way better than the Corvette, it has a way better MPG ratio and it weights less.

Lets compare the engines:
Z06: 5.7 V8 3,115 lb (1,413 kg)
NSX GT-R: 3.5 V6 2,513 lb (1,140 kg)

Displacement difference:
5700cc vs 3500cc

Engine difference:
V8 vs V6

Weight difference:
3,115 lb (1,413 kg) vs 2,513 lb (1,140 kg)

Power output:
385HP vs 500HP

Now I don’t know much about the suspension of the Z06, but the NSX uses a Showa double wishbone suspension.
the NSX has a Hewland 6 speed sequential gearbox. the Z06 has a ?

The only problem is, this is a European cars thread. So I don’t know why the Japanese stable has been released, but they don’t have anything to do with Europa :D.

Read full topic
item.source: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars

item.title: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:163, topic:266373”][quote author=zoltanman link=topic=351831.msg2974544#msg2974544 date=1254178646]

All cars in this thread suck. Volvo > *

do love the box style of the old volvo estates and the design on the C30 is pretty nice as well
zoltanman how did you prove me wrong? i just showed you two cars with different size engines and massively different horsepowers. Regardless of what they are for you dont put an engine in a car and then only use half its potential thats ridiculous. Also pretty sure you got your prices wrong, this is the only second hand zo6 vette i can find on autotrader and its £42,500
and this is the closest i could find to the evo and its £16,995
both used cars massive price differences l2getfacts before posting

oh so pick a 2 year old evo with more miles on it than the corvette? No shit its a lower price

how about compare them new.

that was the mitsubishi i used in my exmample, I wasnt going to change it for price comparison, he said a zo6 would be cheaper than the evo XIII
edit: @ zoltanmann thats an evo X i thought you said you’ve been around garages, also look at the horsepower per 1000cc engine size on both of those cars the evo has more per 1000cc

GOD YOU’RE A FUCKING IDIOT.

Show me a engine WITHOUT forced induction. That engine naturally aspirated doesn’t produce more power per cylinder than the vette. Slap forced induction on the vette then, then it’ll be fair to compare right? Oh wait, you don’t need to because the chevy engine will produce more for less.
[/quote]
you’re calling me an idiot when you just thouht an evo X was an evo VIII? good job on that one[/quote]

When did I ever say that? I used a fair comparison between the two. Which you didn’t, you used some old ass evo which looked like it was in bad shape. Then you compared it to a fairly new c6 vette. I’ve been talking about the C5 model, not the C6… so who’s the idiot…?

yo zoltanman i like u an imma let u do ur thang but abraham is the biggest moron on the forums

Why don’t you contribute to the discussion instead of spamming and looking like more of an idiot then abraham?

Read full topic

item.source: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars

item.title: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:158, topic:266373”][quote author=zoltanman link=topic=351831.msg2973143#msg2973143 date=1254079475]

take the current mustang

The base model is powered by a 210 hp (157 kW) cast-iron block 4.0 L SOHC V6

ok now look at a mitsubishi evo XIII

The FQ400, sold through Ralliart UK, produces 302.13 kW (405.2 hp) from its 2.0 L 4G63 engine

the mitsubishi has an engine half the size yet produces twice the horsepower.

Ok, lets use a car that was never meant to be a performance car to compare to a Mitsubishi Evo.

  1. The evo uses forced induction, which you need on a four banger.
  2. The mustang costs half the price, so what do you expect?

You’re a fucking idiot comparing those cars. For that price you could get a c5 z06 on sterioids and handles and performs way better. It’s naturally aspirated and makes more horsepower. No replacement for displacement. Mitsubishi’s are notorious for breaking down and slapping a turbo on it and all of those electronics. You’re doomed for failure.

Now find a car that’s naturally aspirated. Then come back and talk bud.

Just keep it coming sanga, and I’ll keep proving you wrong.

[/quote]

Let’s pull out the Honda squad with their naturally apsirated engines.

Let’s take examples:

B16A: 4 inline 1.6 liter 170HP < Civic VTI (FWD)
B16B: 4 inline 1.6 liter 185HP < Civic Type-R (FWD)
B18C '98 Spec (Type-R): 4 inline 1.8 liter 220HP < Integra Type-R (FWD)
H22A: 4 inline 2.2 liter 220HP < Prelude VTI (FWD)
K20A: 4 inline 2.0 liter 240HP < Civic Type-R/Integra RSX (FWD)
F20C: 4 inline 2.0 liter 250HP < S2000 (RWD)
C32B: V6 3.2 liter 300HP < NSX (RWD)
C35B: V6 3.5 liter 500HP < NSX GT-R (RWD)

All of those engines are N/A, no turbo involved.[/quote]

Yes, but what if you wanted to take it them way further?

[quote=“sanga282, post:156, topic:266373”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=351831.msg2973118#msg2973118 date=1254079072]
All cars in this thread suck. Volvo > *
[/quote]
do love the box style of the old volvo estates and the design on the C30 is pretty nice as well
zoltanman how did you prove me wrong? i just showed you two cars with different size engines and massively different horsepowers. Regardless of what they are for you dont put an engine in a car and then only use half its potential thats ridiculous. Also pretty sure you got your prices wrong, this is the only second hand zo6 vette i can find on autotrader and its £42,500
and this is the closest i could find to the evo and its £16,995
both used cars massive price differences l2getfacts before posting[/quote]

$30,995

That’s with 11k miles on it…

$32,595

With 2k miles on it.

You showed me an engine with forced induction, what does that engine produce without it? That’s not showing the engines full potential. It’s a four cylinder, without the forced induction, you just can’t produce that power.

The mustang you tried to compare is a everyday car, and it’s way less. So it’s not going to be producing sport car numbers.

ownagesbot:

McLaren F1 > any muscle car and it was built back in 1991. Not even owned? Also a naturally aspirated engine. Sheer engineering genius.

That’s because it’s a McLaren F1, it’s better then anything ever built…

Read full topic

The base model is powered by a 210 hp (157 kW) cast-iron block 4.0 L SOHC V6

The FQ400, sold through Ralliart UK, produces 302.13 kW (405.2 hp) from its 2.0 L 4G63 engine

the mitsubishi has an engine half the size yet produces twice the horsepower.
[/quote]

Ok, lets use a car that was never meant to be a performance car to compare to a Mitsubishi Evo.

  1. The evo uses forced induction, which you need on a four banger.
  2. The mustang costs half the price, so what do you expect?

You’re a fucking idiot comparing those cars. For that price you could get a c5 z06 on sterioids and handles and performs way better. It’s naturally aspirated and makes more horsepower. No replacement for displacement. Mitsubishi’s are notorious for breaking down and slapping a turbo on it and all of those electronics. You’re doomed for failure.

Now find a car that’s naturally aspirated. Then come back and talk bud.

Just keep it coming sanga, and I’ll keep proving you wrong.[/quote]

Let’s pull out the Honda squad with their naturally apsirated engines.

Let’s take examples:

B16A: 4 inline 1.6 liter 170HP < Civic VTI (FWD)
B16B: 4 inline 1.6 liter 185HP < Civic Type-R (FWD)
B18C '98 Spec (Type-R): 4 inline 1.8 liter 220HP < Integra Type-R (FWD)

item.title: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:149, topic:266373”]Hey guys, my name is Zoltanman, I think that because I can post about one make of car being better than one make of a European car I have proven the American cars are bad theory wrong.

AMERICAN CARS ARE STILL TERRIBLE.

POOR TURNING
FUCKING UGLY
TERRIBLE MPG
STUPID INTERIORS
POWER IS NOT EVERYTHING
HEY LOOK AT THIS CAR IT’S HUGE, IT MUST B GR8.[/quote]

What the fuck? Are you stuck in the 1950’s? The muscle car era is way gone.

POOR TURNING - Cobalt SS, import and excellent turning.

FUCKING UGLY - That’s an opinion.

TERRIBLE MPG - Haha, so terrible mpg is 30 on the highway with a car that is making over 400hp to the crank? Yeah right.

STUPID INTERIORS - I’ll agree with you on that one, but you can get nice interior as options on most cars.

POWER IS NOT EVERYTHING - Like I said, you’re stuck in the 1950s with that statement. New camaro’s and challengers are MADE that way. They’re made to bring back the muscle car and sell to people who love those kind of cars.

HEY LOOK AT THIS CAR IT’S HUGE, IT MUST B GR8. - Dodge neon srt4, cobalt ss, pontiac g6 gxp…just to name a few compact cars.

At least prove it, or I’ll keep doggin you and let your e-friends come to the rescue to make fun of me.

sanga282:

also americans use big engines yet get small power amounts from them, its almost retarded

Like when? Name off some cars…back up your statements.

Read full topic
item.source: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars

item.title: The Debate: Why European cars shit on American cars
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Hey guys, my name is Zoltanman, I think that because I can post about one make of car being better than one make of a European car I have proven the American cars are bad theory wrong.

AMERICAN CARS ARE STILL TERRIBLE.
